meanings.definition: Spread or smear (a substance) thinly over a surface.
meanings.sent1: She was shmearing butter on her toast.
meanings.sent2: The chef was shmearing sauce on the pizza.
meanings.sent3: The cat was shmearing its paw prints all over the freshly cleaned floor.
meanings.sent4: The artist was shmearing colors on the canvas, creating a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent5: The child was happily shmearing paint on the paper, creating a colorful mess.

meanings.definition: To apply a thin layer of a substance onto something.
meanings.sent1: He was carefully shmearing cream on his sunburn.
meanings.sent2: The gardener was shmearing fertilizer on the plants.
meanings.sent3: The prankster was shmearing toothpaste on the doorknob for a silly joke.
meanings.sent4: The sun was shmearing its golden rays across the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The baker was shmearing icing on the cake, making it look delicious.

meanings.definition: To cover or coat something with a thin layer of a substance.
meanings.sent1: She was shmearing jam on the bread for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The worker was shmearing glue on the broken pieces to fix them.
meanings.sent3: The child was shmearing mud on the toy car, pretending it was stuck in the mud.
meanings.sent4: The fog was shmearing the landscape, making it look mysterious.
meanings.sent5: The decorator was shmearing paint on the walls, giving the room a fresh look.
